member.name: F:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.AdditionalStatusTags
member.summary: The values of the additional tags. The value types must correspond to the defined tag type. Only the following .NET types are supported: byte, ushort, uint, ulong, float, string and string[]

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.SystemTime
member.summary: Lower accuracy system timestamp for the frame. Could be used as a backup time reference in case of a problem with the main timing hardware.

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.GPSTrackedSatellites
member.summary: Number of tracked GPS satellites

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.GPSAlmanacStatus
member.summary: The status of the GPS almanac update

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.GPSAlmanacOffset
member.summary: The almanac offset in seconds that was added to the uncorrected time reported by the GPS in order to compute the UTC time

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.GPSFixStatus
member.summary: The status of the GPS fix

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.Gain
member.summary: The gain of the camera in dB

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.Shutter
member.summary: Camera shutter speed in seconds

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.Gamma
member.summary: The gamma correction applied to the produced image

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.CameraOffset
member.summary: The offset in percentage applied to the produced image

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.VideoCameraFrameId
member.summary: The id of the frame as labeled by the camera frame counter

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.UserCommands
member.summary: The user commands executed since the last recorded frame. Up to 16 lines, each line up to 255 characters.

member.name: P:Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry.SystemErrors
member.summary: System errors detected since the last recorded frame. Up to 16 lines, each line up to 255 characters.

member.name: F:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.StatusSectionConfig
member.summary: The status section configuration to be used for the ADV file when StartRecordingNewFile() is called.

member.name: F:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.FileMetaData
member.summary: The file metadata to be saved in the file when StartRecordingNewFile() is called.

member.name: F:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.ImageConfig
member.summary: The image configuration to be used for the ADV file when StartRecordingNewFile() is called.

member.name: F:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.LocationData
member.summary: The location data to be saved in the file when StartRecordingNewFile() is called.

member.name: M:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.StartRecordingNewFile(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new ADV file and gets it ready for recording

member.name: M:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.FinishRecording
member.summary: Closes the AVD file and stops any recording to it.

member.name: M:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.AddVideoFrame(System.Byte[],System.Boolean,Adv.AdvImageData,Adv.AdvTimeStamp,System.UInt32,Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry)
member.summary: Adds a new video frame from a byte array.
member.param: The pixels to be saved. The row-major array is of size Width * Height in 8-bit mode and 2 * Width * Height in little-endian 16-bit mode.
True if the frame is to be compressed. Please note that compression is CPU and I/O intensive and may not work at high frame rates. Use wisely.
The format of the pixels - 8 bit or 16 bit.

The high accuracy timestamp for the middle of the frame. If the timestamp is not with an accuracy of 1ms then set it as zero. A lower accuracy timestamp can be specified in the SystemTime status value.

The duration of the frame in whole 0.1 ms as determined by the high accuracy timestamping. If high accuracy timestamp is not available then set this to zero. Note that the Shutter status value should be derived from the camera settings rather than from the timestamps.
The status metadata to be saved with the video frame.

member.name: M:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.AddVideoFrame(System.UInt16[],System.Boolean,Adv.AdvTimeStamp,System.UInt32,Obsolete.AdvStatusEntry)
member.summary: Adds a new video frame from an ushort array.
member.param: The pixels to be saved. The row-major array is of size 2 * Width * Height. This only works in little-endian 16-bit mode.
True if the frame is to be compressed. Please note that compression is CPU and I/O intensive and may not work at high frame rates. Use wisely.

The high accuracy timestamp for the middle of the frame. If the timestamp is not with an accuracy of 1ms then set it as zero. A lower accuracy timestamp can be specified in the SystemTime status value.

The duration of the frame in whole 0.1 ms as determined by the high accuracy timestamping. If high accuracy timestamp is not available then set this to zero. Note that the Shutter status value should be derived from the camera settings rather than from the timestamps.
The status metadata to be saved with the video frame.

member.name: M:Obsolete.AdvVer1.AdvRecorder.SetNativeDllDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a directory to the search path for AdvLib.Core32.dll and AdvLib.Core64.dll
member.param: The full path to AdvLib.Core32.dll and AdvLib.Core64.dll

member.name: F:Adv.AdvRecorder.ImageConfig
member.summary: The image configuration to be used for the ADV file when StartRecordingNewFile() is called.

member.name: M:Adv.AdvRecorder.StartRecordingNewFile(System.String,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates new ADV file and gets it ready for recording

member.name: M:Adv.AdvRecorder.FinishRecording
member.summary: Closes the AVD file and stops any recording to it.

member.name: M:Adv.AdvRecorder.AdvImageConfig.SetImageParameters(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.Byte,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Sets the image configuration. Here are some examples:
8 bit camera, running with x4 frames on the fly integration, pixel values saved as 16 bit: Image Bits Per Pixel: 16 bit Pixel Max Value: 0x3FC (1020)
14 bit camera with image saved as 16 bit (unscaled):
Image Bits Per Pixel: 16 bit Pixel Max Value: 0x3FFF (16383)
14 bit camera with image scaled to and saved as 16 bit:
Image Bits Per Pixel: 16 bit Pixel Max Value: null
16 bit camera with image saved as 16 bit:
Image Bits Per Pixel: 16 bit Pixel Max Value: null
12 bit camera with image saved as 12 bit (2 pixels in 3 bytes):
Image Bits Per Pixel: 12 bit Pixel Max Value: null
member.param: The width of the image in pixels.
The height of the image in pixels.
The bit depth of the pixel values saved in the image.
The upper limit of the dynamic range of the image expressed as the maximum pixel value (or null if not applicable).

member.name: M:Adv.AdvRecorder.AdvImageConfig.SetBayerPattern(Adv.BayerPattern)
member.summary: Sets the bayer pattern used by the CCD colour chip to one of the predefined values
member.param: The bayer pattern to be set

member.name: M:Adv.AdvRecorder.AdvLocationData.SetLocation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the location.
member.param: Longitude in degrees- positive to the east and negative to the west.
Latitude in degrees - positive to the north and negative to the south.
Altitude in meters.
The position reference e.g. 'WGS84'
An indication of the accuracy of the position. For GPS derived positions this could be HDOP value, for fixed coordinates this could be for example '+/-1m'

member.name: P:Adv.AdvRecorder.AdvLocationData.PositionReference
member.summary: The position reference e.g. 'WGS84'

member.name: P:Adv.AdvRecorder.AdvLocationData.PositionAccuracy
member.summary: An indication of the accuracy of the position. For GPS derived positions this could be HDOP value, for fixed coordinates this could be for example '+/-1m'

member.name: T:Adv.AdvTimeStamp
member.summary: Represents the ADV system time which is the number of milliseconds elapsed since: 1 Jan 2010, 00:00:00 GMT
